item.title: Finding the meaning of a command
item.description: ConTeXt has a nice command to find a meaning of a command. Sometimes the easiest way to find the meaning of a macro is to simply use \show\macroname In LMTX, context defaults to running with --batchmode, which means that you then have to hunt for the output of \show in the console output. ConTeXt comes with a nice script to simply get the meaning of a macro on console. $ mtxrun --script interface --meaning <macroname> For example:
